title: Help With H&J's
content:
I’m looking for some guidance and resources to help me adjust H&J’s. I’m working in Quark and do not trust it’s default settings but I’m also not confident i can do a better job so I’m looking for some education. Any help is appreciated.

 [‹ suckerfish menu & css help](http://web.archive.org/web/20080908022752/http:/typophile.com/node/13953 "Go to previous forum topic") [Black ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080908022752/http:/typophile.com/node/13795 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Thousand Leaves

comments.content: Typophiles generally prefer to set character spacing at zero (or is it 100%, it’s been a while since I looked at Quark).

You might check out [James Felici’s _Complete Manual of Typography_](http://web.archive.org/web/20080908022752/http:/www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/0321127307/qid=1121724609/sr=2-1/ref=pd_bbs_b_2_1/102-2826386-8300115).

FWIW, I typically set H&Js to something like this:  
Word spacing: 75 100 125.  
Character spacing: 0 0 0.
thanks for the comments so far. also, i wanted to mention, in case it wasn’t clear, i am setting justified type.
